intro: Lepidosperma monticola, commonly known as the mountain sedges, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in rocky or sandy habitats. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. Lepidosperma monticola is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
